title: Hazard Road Markings
image_desc: A close-up shot of various hazard road markings on a road surface.
content: -  Hazard road markings warn drivers of potential dangers.
They improve road safety and prevent accidents.
narration: Welcome! Today we're going to talk about hazard road markings. These markings are crucial for keeping drivers safe by alerting them to potential dangers on the road.

title: Purpose of Hazard Road Markings
image_desc: A car approaching a sharp turn with a chevron marking on the road.
content: Improve road safety and prevent accidents.
narration: The main purpose of hazard road markings is to warn drivers of potential dangers ahead. This could be anything from a sharp turn to a pedestrian crossing or an obstacle. By alerting drivers, these markings help to prevent accidents and keep everyone safe.

title: Materials Used
image_desc: A close-up shot of a road marking being applied with a road striping machine.
content: Reflective materials for visibility at night.
narration: Hazard road markings are made from durable materials like thermoplastic or road-grade paint. These materials are designed to withstand the wear and tear of traffic and weather conditions.  They also often include reflective materials, which make them highly visible even at night or in bad weather.

title: Types of Hazard Road Markings
image_desc: A diagram showing different types of hazard road markings, including chevron markings, zigzag lines, and diagonal lines.
content: -  Chevron markings: Indicate a sharp change in direction.
Zigzag lines: Used near pedestrian crossings.
Diagonal lines: Mark areas where vehicles should not stop or drive.
narration: There are different types of hazard road markings, each with a specific purpose.  Chevron markings, for example, indicate a sharp change in direction. Zigzag lines are used near pedestrian crossings to alert drivers to be cautious. And diagonal lines mark areas where vehicles should not stop or drive.

title: Preparation and Application
image_desc: A worker cleaning a road surface before applying road markings.
content: -  Road surface is cleaned and repaired.
Markings are applied using specialized equipment.
narration: Before applying hazard road markings, the road surface must be properly prepared. This involves cleaning and repairing any damage to ensure the markings adhere properly.  The markings are then applied using specialized equipment like road striping machines or manual methods for smaller areas.

title: Curing and Maintenance
image_desc: A road with freshly applied road markings drying in the sun.
content: -  Material is allowed to dry or cure.
Regular inspection and reapplication are necessary.
narration: Once the markings are applied, they need time to dry or cure before the road is reopened to traffic.  After that, regular inspection and reapplication are necessary to maintain visibility and effectiveness.  This ensures that the markings continue to warn drivers and keep the roads safe.
